intro: Saussurea glanduligera var. major, commonly known as the large glandular saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has rough, hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that bloom in late summer. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing at high altitudes with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
